version_description:
~ Regressions! If you're on an iPad, try the regressions tour in the help menu. If you're on an iPhone, try the regressions tour on a larger screen before you start modeling on your phone.

- Support for iPhone 6 and 6 Plus

- Portrait mode fi

~ Regressions! If you're on an iPad, try the regressions tour in the help menu. If you're on an iPhone, try the regressions tour on a larger screen before you start modeling on your phone.

- Support for iPhone 6 and 6 Plus

- Portrait mode fi

ACCOUNTS ARE HERE! Press the three lines in the top left corner to sign in, sync up, and take all of your graphs on the go.

Also included in this update:
* implicit inequalities
* draggable table columns
* a ton of new example graphs
*

ACCOUNTS ARE HERE! Press the three lines in the top left corner to sign in, sync up, and take all of your graphs on the go.

Also included in this update:
* implicit inequalities
* draggable table columns
* a ton of new example graphs
*
Now with integrals! Type "int" to get out of the deriver's seat and into this fundamental new feature.
Now with integrals! Type "int" to get out of the deriver's seat and into this fundamental new feature.
Now with integrals and a few bug fixes! Type "int" to get out of the deriver's seat and into this fundamental new feature.
Now with integrals and a few bug fixes! Type "int" to get out of the deriver's seat and into this fundamental new feature.

- Bug fixes and performance improvements.
- Slimmer file size for Fall fashions.
- Slider limits and parametric domains now support constant expressions like multiples of π. No more 0 < t < 6.28 nonsense.

- Bug fixes and performance improvements.
- Slimmer file size for Fall fashions.
- Slider limits and parametric domains now support constant expressions like multiples of π. No more 0 < t < 6.28 nonsense.

* Bug fixes and performance improvements.
* Make points movable without adding sliders! Just press and hold a point's expression icon and select a drag mode.
* Slider limits and parametric domains now support constant expressions like multiples of π

* Bug fixes and performance improvements.
* Make points movable without adding sliders! Just press and hold a point's expression icon and select a drag mode.
* Slider limits and parametric domains now support constant expressions like multiples of π
Now with multitasking support on iPads! We also fixed a crash bug with adding images to the graph.
Now with multitasking support on iPads! We also fixed a crash bug with adding images to the graph.
Performance improvements, bug fixes, and new features - including image rotations!

- Fixed a bug where equations that always evaluated to true or false were plotted as 1 or 0.
- User-defined labels can include interpolated constants.
- In order to better align with versions of Desmos apps used on high-stakes tests, solutions to si
Performance improvements, bug fixes, and new features - including image rotations!

- Fixed a bug where equations that always evaluated to true or false were plotted as 1 or 0.
- User-defined labels can include interpolated constants.
- In order to better align with versions of Desmos apps used on high-stakes tests, solutions to si
Performance improvements, bug fixes, and new features - including image rotations!
Performance improvements, bug fixes, and new features - including image rotations!
Now with better external keyboard support and performance improvements.
Now with better external keyboard support and performance improvements.
Bug fixes.
Bug fixes.
Once again, with iOS 9 support!
Once again, with iOS 9 support!
Hope you're having a great summer! This update fixes a few bugs.
Hope you're having a great summer! This update fixes a few bugs.
Fixed a bug that prevented saving screenshots to your device.
Now with 32bit support!
Fixed a bug that prevented saving screenshots to your device.
Now with 32bit support!
Fixed a bug that prevented saving screenshots to your device.
Fixed a bug that prevented saving screenshots to your device.
Fresh new 2020 look! Histograms, distributions, decimal-to-fraction, dark mode, and more.
Fresh new 2020 look! Histograms, distributions, decimal-to-fraction, dark mode, and more.
Bug fixes
Bug fixes
It's now possible to change your preferred language from within the app.
It's now possible to change your preferred language from within the app.
Improved trig and exponential regressions.
Improved trig and exponential regressions.

New list functionality in the graphing calculator:
- Added sort, shuffle, and join functions
- Added syntax for selecting several elements from a list. If L is a list, L[1,3,5] selects three elements from the list, L[3...5] selects the third through

New list functionality in the graphing calculator:
- Added sort, shuffle, and join functions
- Added syntax for selecting several elements from a list. If L is a list, L[1,3,5] selects three elements from the list, L[3...5] selects the third through
Integrals may now have infinite bounds
Integrals may now have infinite bounds

* You can now access audio trace from the built in keypad in the graphing calculator. Graph a curve and look for the sound icon in the keypad at the bottom of the screen.
* Improved translations

* You can now access audio trace from the built in keypad in the graphing calculator. Graph a curve and look for the sound icon in the keypad at the bottom of the screen.
* Improved translations
Bug fixes and localization improvements.
Bug fixes and localization improvements.
Bug fixes and localization improvements.
Bug fixes and localization improvements.
Bug fixes and localization improvements.
Bug fixes and localization improvements.

* Box plots now support special display of outliers.
* You can now add custom colors to your graphs using the rgb() and hsv() functions. When you assign a color expression to a variable, the color you create will appear as an option in the expression s

* Box plots now support special display of outliers.
* You can now add custom colors to your graphs using the rgb() and hsv() functions. When you assign a color expression to a variable, the color you create will appear as an option in the expression s
